job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-07-15T19:40:56.000Z", "description": "

Interested in joining a growing SaaS company AND work remotely? We are partnering with a quickly growing SaaS company in the real estate and sustainability space. The software delivers tools for gathering and monitoring sustainability data. This high energy environment is focused on collaboration and rewarding employees\u2019 hard work.


We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist to join their team! This role works within the organization and within their software to determine the questions that need answers, and then identifies new and novel solutions to solve the problem. The Data Scientist is responsible for applying data mining techniques, performing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems.


Key Responsibilities:


Data Analysis & Validation

\u25cf       Apply various quantitative methods to analyze and interpret the company\u2019s data

\u25cf       Clean, transform, and organize data for analysis and ensure its quality

\u25cf       Interpret trends and patterns in data

\u25cf       Work with key stakeholders and team members to gather and understand how data is used and identify best practices

\u25cf       Assemble large, complex sets of data that meet non-functional and functional business requirements, conduct complex data analysis and report on results

\u25cf       Combine raw information from different sources and prepare data for prescriptive and predictive modeling

 

Communication and Education

\u25cf       Communicate complex analyses in a clear and actionable manner to stakeholders across the organization

\u25cf       Serve as a science liaison within the organization and externally through customer engagements

\u25cf       Compile technical and high level supporting documentation to ensure understanding across teams and consistency of practices

\u25cf       Support and influence conversations and decisions regarding product defining, planning and design

\u25cf       Identify new business questions where the data science team can add value


Statistical Learning Models

\u25cf       Design, test, verify and implement production ready data pipelines and machine learning models

\u25cf       Identify the appropriate data and methodologies to use based on the need

\u25cf       Work with development teams to implement data science models as services


Requirements:

\u25cf       Graduate degree in STEM or Economics

\u25cf       1-3 years experience working in applied math, computer science, statistics, or related quantitative field

\u25cf       Professional experience in Python and database programming

\u25cf       A combination of professional or educational experience (whether formal or informal) that affords you with the knowledge, skills, and abilities above


This is an exciting, fully remote opportunity to grow your career in a progressive organization! This position offers a salary of $105-$145K, depending on experience! Please apply on-line at www.aimhiredenver.com for immediate consideration.


AimHire is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

Keywords: data science, data scientist, python, data modeling, predictive analysis, data mining, statistical analysis
